Miguel decided to create the world's

bulletproof material back then was
Kevlar developed in the 1960s to replace
old nylon ballistic vests ballistic
materials like Kevlar use a web-like
construction called it aramid weave its
molecules have ring-like structures that
connect to form super-strength chains
when a bullet hits the fabric the energy
radiates outwards spreading the impact
over a wide area
so why go to all this effort when you
